artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Matsui Eikichi; Carver: Takimoto Chokuzan
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 492; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 217, p. 291.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: two separate sheets/vertical; man in foreground wearing light blue tunic with purple and gold flowers and black trim, white pants and black boots, holding a bloody sword; slain man behind first man, lying in snow, with a red staff punctured into his body, wearing a brown blouse and white pants; large mountain peak in background; falling snow; fire at center left
dimension: 15 1/8 × 10 1/8 in. (38.42 × 25.72 cm) (sheet, each, approx., vertical ōban, upright diptych)
markings: Artist’s seal: 芳年之印 {Yoshitoshi no in} | Carver’s seal: 彫工根岸直山 {horikō Negishi Chokuzan}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Untitled series of upright diptychs
title: ‘Panther Head’ Lin Chong Kills Officer Lu Outside the Mountain Temple
